OaboyinaMCu (T, M, Ḳ) and buyanaMCu and [of pauc.] OaboyaAnN: (Lḥ, M, Ḳ:) the second of these pls. is anomalous: the last is formed by likening faEiylN to faAEilN: [for bay-inN is a contraction of bayiynN:] but the pl. most agreeable with analogy is bay-inuwna: so says Sb. (M.)

bay-inapN An evidence, an indication, a demonstration, a proof, a voucher, or an argument, (Mgh, TA,) such as is manifest, or. clear, whether intellectual or perceived by sense; (TA;) [originally bayiynapN,] of the measure faEiylapN, from bayonuwnapN, [see 1, first sentence,] and bayaAnN [q. v.]: (Mgh:) and the testimony of a witness: pl. bay-inaAtN. (TA.)

hom.sense: baAYinN In a state of separation or disunion; or separated, severed, disunited, or cut off; (M,* Mṣb;) as also Oaboyanu↓, occurring in a verse cited above, voce bay-ina. [Hence,] AimoraOapN baAYinN A woman separated from her husband by divorce; (M, Mṣb, Ḳ;) as also mubaAnapN↓: the former without p: (Mṣb:) like TaAliqN and HaAYiDN: you say [to a wife] Oanoti baAYinN [Thou art separated from me by divorce.] (Mgh.)

TalaAqN baAYinN is a tropical phrase; and so is TaloqapN baAYinapN; (Mgh;) [signifying the same as] taToliyqapN baAYinapN (Ṣ, M, Mṣb, Ḳ) ‡ A divorce that is [as it were] cut off; i. q. mubaAnapN↓ [in the second and third of these phrases, and mubaAnN↓ in the first]: (ISk, Mṣb:) bAYnp being here used in the sense of a pass. part. n.: (Ṣ, Ṣgh, Mṣb:) or it [is a possessive epithet, and thus] means having separation: this kind of divorce is one in the case of which the man cannot take back the woman unless by a new contract; (TA;) nor without her consent. (MF in art. bt.)

qawosN baAYinapN, (Ṣ, M, Ḳ,) and baAYinN, (M, Ḳ,) A bow that is widely separate from its string: (Ṣ, M, Ḳ:) contr. of baAniyapN; (Ṣ, M;) this signifying one that is so near to its string as almost to stick to it: (Ṣ:) each of these denotes what is a fault. (Ṣ, M.)
biYorN baAYinapN: see bayuwnN.
naxolapN baAYinapN A palm-tree of which the racemes have come forth from the spathes, and of which the fruit-stalks have grown long. (AḤn, M.)

AlbaAYinu also signifies He who comes to the milch beast [meaning the she-camel, when she is to be milked,] from her left side; (Ṣ, Ḳ;) and AlmuEal-iI, he who comes to her from her right side: (Ṣ:) or the former, he who stands on the right of the she-camel when she is milked, and holds the milking-vessel, and raises it to the milker, who stands on her left, and is called AlmusotaEoliI: (T:) two persons are engaged in milking the she-camel; one of them holds the milking-vessel on the right side, and the other milks on the left side; and the milker is called AlmusotaEoliI and AlmuEal-iI; and the holder, AlbAYn: (M:) pl. buy-anN. (T.) It is said in a prov., Aisotu AlbaAYini OaEorafu, or, as some say, OaEolamu; meaning † He who has superintended an affair, and exercised himself diligently in the management thereof, is better acquainted with it than he who has not done this. (T. [See Freytag's Arab. Prov. i. 606.])
TawiylN baAYinN Excessively tall, far above the stature of tall men. (TA.)
See also bay-inN.

entry.sense: Talaba UilaI Oabawayohi AlbaAYinapa He asked, or begged, of his two parents, the separation of himself from them, by [their giving him] property, (AZ, T, M,) to be his alone. (T.)

hom.sense: Oaboyanu: see baAYinN.
fulaAnN Oaboyanu mino fulaAnK Such a one is more perspicuous, clear, distinct, chaste, or eloquent, in speech or language, than such a one. (Ṣ, TA.)

entry.sense: tiboyaAnN an anomalous inf. n. (T, Ṣ, Ḳ) of 2, q. v.: (T:) or a subst. used as an inf. n.; (MF, TA;) i. e., a subst. from 2. (Sb, M, TA.) See bayaAnN.

hom.sense: mubiynN Separating, severing, disuniting, or cutting off; (Ṣ, Ḳ;) as also muboyinN, like muHosinN: (Ḳ:) but [the right reading in the Ḳ may be wamubiynN kamuHosinK, meaning “and mubiynN is like muHosinN:“ if not,] muboyinN is a mistake. (TA.)
See also bay-inN, in two places.

entry.sense: mabaAyinu AlHaq-i [in which the former word is app. pl. of mubiynapN] signifies The things that make the truth to be apparent, manifest, evident, clear, or plain; or the means of making it so; syn. mawaADiHuhu. (TA.)
1. baAha lahu, aor. yabaAhu, inf. n. bayohN; and maA bihotu lahu: see 1 in art. bwh.
